item.description:
Projects

Student projects during my engineering school degree

Capture-the-flag for a software security course

  • ğŸ—“ï¸ November - December 2022
  • ğŸ–¥ï¸ Binary / Assembler
  • ğŸŒ Available on my GitHub
  • âš™ï¸ Reverse-engineering on full black-box binaries to find flags to validate challenges. In addition, there were two exploit challenge where I had to find a buffer overflow, and exploit it to validate the challenge.

Symphony orchestra simulator

  • ğŸ—“ï¸ May 2022
  • ğŸ–¥ï¸ C
  • ğŸŒ Available on my GitHub
  • âš™ï¸ Client-server software written in C to play and manage remotely sound playback. One side is connected to speaker to play the sound, and the other side acts as a console to manage the first side. Each sides communicate with other via sockets. A specific language has been developed to script operations.
item.content:
Projects

Student projects during my engineering school degree

Capture-the-flag for a software security course

  • ğŸ—“ï¸ November - December 2022
  • ğŸ–¥ï¸ Binary / Assembler
  • ğŸŒ Available on my GitHub
  • âš™ï¸ Reverse-engineering on full black-box binaries to find flags to validate challenges. In addition, there were two exploit challenge where I had to find a buffer overflow, and exploit it to validate the challenge.

Symphony orchestra simulator

  • ğŸ—“ï¸ May 2022
  • ğŸ–¥ï¸ C
  • ğŸŒ Available on my GitHub
  • âš™ï¸ Client-server software written in C to play and manage remotely sound playback. One side is connected to speaker to play the sound, and the other side acts as a console to manage the first side. Each sides communicate with other via sockets. A specific language has been developed to script operations.

During my engineering school degree

Research internship at ZÃ¼rich (Switzerland)

  • ğŸ—“ï¸ May - August 2022 (3 months)
  • ğŸ–¥ï¸ Detection of Bluetooth Low Energy trackers (Ex : Apple AirTags)
  • ğŸ“– Report (In English)
  • âœ… Assessment form (In English)
  • âš™ï¸ Bluetooth trackers are small, stand-alone devices that can locate any objects (Wallets etc.) at any time. Even though they are designed for that, malicious users can turn away them to spy people. The goal of this internship was developing a technique to detect those objects around a person. This internship was in line with the PhD of Katharina O.E. MÃœLLER.
